title: Sample and Population Proportions: Cigarettes
question_text:
Read the following problem:
A recent survey of $500$ randomly sampled Maryland residents found that $17\%$ smoke cigarettes on a regular basis. This compares to the national average of $24\%$ of the population who smoke on a regular basis.
Which of the value deals with sample proportions and which deals with population proportions?

choices.text: The $17\%$ figure is a sample proportion, while the $24\%$ figure is a population proportion.
The $24\%$ figure is a sample proportion, while the $17\%$ figure is a population proportion.
The $17\%$ figure is a sample proportion, while the $24\%$ figure is neither a sample nor a population proportion.
